messages.content: ComfyUI-AniPortrait is an extension or custom node for ComfyUI that supports the new version of diffusers, allowing for the generation of animated portraits.
Who contributed to the development of ComfyUI-AniPortrait?
WainWong contributed to the development of ComfyUI-AniPortrait.
What is the recommended Python version for setting up the ComfyUI-AniPortrait environment?
The recommended Python version for setting up the ComfyUI-AniPortrait environment is >=3.10.
What is the recommended CUDA version for setting up the ComfyUI-AniPortrait environment?
The recommended CUDA version for setting up the ComfyUI-AniPortrait environment is 11.7.
What are the five parts of the trained weights needed for ComfyUI-AniPortrait?
The five parts of the trained weights needed for ComfyUI-AniPortrait are `denoising_unet.pth`, `reference_unet.pth`, `pose_guider.pth`, `motion_module.pth`, and `audio2mesh.pt`.
What are the additional pretrained weights and components required for ComfyUI-AniPortrait?
The additional pretrained weights and components required for ComfyUI-AniPortrait are StableDiffusion V1.5, sd-vae-ft-mse, image_encoder, and wav2vec2-base-960h.
Where should the appropriate paths for the weights and components be entered in ComfyUI-AniPortrait?
The appropriate paths for the weights and components should be entered in the node in ComfyUI-AniPortrait.
